item.title: Notes around my failed idea of `Patching Kubernetes nodes with fixes without restarting the nodes`
item.description: Codename suraj2

item.title: How to find Project ID and Issue Type ID in Jira without any special permissions
item.description: Problem How do you find Project ID and Issue Type ID in Jira when you don’t have any special permissions? Solution Note: This works for Jira Cloud. I haven’t tested it with Jira Server. 1. Go to https://<your-jira-name>.atlassian.net/secure/CreateIssue.jspa (example: https://banakarsuraj.atlassian.net/secure/CreateIssue.jspa) You should see a screen like this: 2. Right click and select Inspect 3. Find the Ids 3.1. For Project Id Search for #project-options HTML Id in the Inspect Element tab Double click on Recent projects and you should see it expand like this: Copy the highlighted part between the white spaces.

item.title: Notes to supplement understanding OpenFeature
item.description: I share some notes I took while going through the docs of OpenFeature

item.title: How to fix mongodb permission `Permission denied` issue in Keptn
